title: Swedish Meatballs
tagline: Tender meatballs in creamy gravy. Better than IKEA.
description: Tender meatballs in creamy gravy. Better than IKEA.
steps: Soak breadcrumbs in milk for 5 minutes.
Mix beef, pork, egg, soaked breadcrumbs, salt, allspice, and nutmeg. Don't overmix.
Roll into 1-inch balls. You should get about 30.
Brown meatballs in batches in butter over medium heat. Set aside.
In same pan, whisk flour into drippings. Cook 1 minute.
Slowly whisk in beef broth, then cream. Simmer until thickened, about 5 minutes.
Add Worcestershire. Return meatballs to sauce.
Simmer 10 minutes until meatballs are cooked through.
Serve over egg noodles or mashed potatoes.
notes: Allspice is key: It's the signature Swedish flavor.
Don't skip the pork: It keeps meatballs tender.
Make ahead: Meatballs freeze well in sauce.
